intro: Sotoa confusa, commonly known as the confused sotoa, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found near water bodies. Due to its unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
